title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: India to monitor solar equipment imports with new system
items.author: Shilpa Samant, Deepshikha Sikarwar
items.summary:
- India plans a dedicated import monitoring system to track *solar* equipment by content, origin and HS codes to improve visibility and compliance. 
- The system may require advance declarations and automatic registration before customs, mirroring controls on steel and paper to enforce **ALMM** and boost *domestic manufacturing*. 
- India’s module capacity has crossed 100 GW and could reach 200 GW by FY28, raising export uncertainties and supply‑chain implications.

items.title: India probes Chinese imports of solar cell components
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The Commerce Ministry arm *DGTR* has launched an *anti-dumping* probe into imports of *solar encapsulants* (excluding EVA) and mobile covers from *China* after complaints by RenewSys India and the All India Mobile Cover Manufacturer Association.
- If *dumping* is established, *DGTR* will recommend import *levies* to curb injury to domestic players, with the Finance Ministry making the final decision.
- Separately, *DGTR* opened a *countervailing duty* probe into *clear float glass* imports from Malaysia and Indonesia over alleged subsidisation harming local producers.

items.title: L&T secures $700M sustainability-linked trade facility
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- L&T has secured a *$700 million* Sustainability-Linked Trade Facility (SLTF) from *Standard Chartered*, aligned with Loan Market Association sustainability principles.
- The SLTF ties pricing to sustainability *KPIs* such as greenhouse gas emission intensity and freshwater withdrawal targets crucial to L&T's operations.
- This follows L&T's earlier *$60 million* sustainability bond and strengthens ESG-linked financing across its global EPC and manufacturing businesses.

items.title: Tata Steel pact with Dutch govt to cut carbon at IJmuiden
items.summary:
- Tata Steel signed a non-binding pact with the Dutch government to transition the *IJmuiden* plant to *low-carbon* steel production.
- The government intends to provide up to **€2 billion**, while Tata Steel Nederland has applied to the *EU Innovation Fund* for **€0.3 billion**.
- Total expenditure is not finalised; remaining costs are expected to come from Tata Steel Nederland's cash, project financing debt and funding by Tata Steel.

items.title: ArcelorMittal–Nippon Steel to build ₹1.47L-cr plant in Vizag
items.author: Siva G, TIMESOFINDIA.COM
items.summary:
- The *ArcelorMittal–Nippon Steel* joint venture will build a **₹1.47 lakh crore** steel complex near *Visakhapatnam*, targeting 8.2 Mtpa initially and 10.5 Mtpa by 2033.
- The project is phased with a captive port (five berths in phase one, 12 in phase two) and is expected to generate about *61,000* jobs plus *8,000* at the port.
- Public hearings recorded no outright opposition but demanded better *compensation* and employment guarantees as the state plans ~*4,000 acres* for phase two.

items.title: BSNL 4G project needed 16x jump in BTS manufacturing capacity: Tejas Networks’ Sanjay Malik
What manufacturers can learn from Lighthouse Network

Vodafone Idea’s enterprise arm partners AWS, C-DoT for IoT innovation lab in Mumbai
US drug recalls: Glenmark, Granules, Sun Pharma and others
items.summary:
- Indian drugmakers including *Glenmark*, *Granules India*, *Sun Pharma*, *Zydus* and *Unichem* are voluntarily recalling products in the US over *manufacturing issues*, the *USFDA* Enforcement Report says.
- Glenmark Pharmaceuticals USA initiated a Class II recall on Sept 17 for 13,824 tubes of *Azelaic Acid Gel* made at its Goa plant due to *CGMP deviations* and consumer complaints of a gritty texture.
- The recalls expose compliance gaps for Indian exporters, may disrupt US supply chains, and could prompt heightened *regulatory scrutiny* and reputational impact long-term.

items.title: Premier Energies secures $20 mn solar contracts in West Africa
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Premier Energies won *$19.95 million* contracts to install **750 rooftop solar systems**, over **4,400** solar streetlights and **650** solar water heaters across the Republic of Benin.
- The work, funded via a Line of Credit from *EXIM Bank* and the *ECOWAS Bank (EBID)* and implemented with Benin’s energy ministry, aims to boost community safety, healthcare, education and energy access.
- The Hyderabad-based firm is expanding manufacturing to *8.4 GW* (cells) and *11.1 GW* (modules) by June 2026 and moving into batteries, wafers and inverters.

items.title: Moët Hennessy India appoints Siddharth Suri as Managing Director
PM Modi to inaugurate CM's short-term employability courses programme
Axiscades gets defence order to supply drones to Indian Army
Auto components, FMCG, defence among 9 sectors set to benefit from festive demand
GST rationalisation to augur well for manufacturing output in September-October
Electronics manufacturing to become major employer: Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- *Electronics manufacturing* in *India* is expanding rapidly with new suppliers and growing *design capabilities*, driven mainly by small and medium enterprises.
- The sector is poised to become a major *employment* source as India shifts from assembly to advanced chip design, highlighted by ARM's Bengaluru office and a homegrown **2nm** chip effort.
- Strong government backing — including the *India Semiconductor Mission* (₹76,000 crore), 10 approved projects (₹1.6 lakh crore) and DLI-supported startups — is accelerating the ecosystem.

items.title: Dynabook begins soft launch of laptop assembly at Syrma SGS facility
Oyster Renewable Energy arms gets ₹1,844 cr project loan
JLR begins phased restart after cyberattack
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- *Jaguar Land Rover* (JLR) will implement a controlled, *phased restart* of some UK manufacturing operations in the coming days after a cyberattack halted production across multiple global facilities.
- The company, via parent *Tata Motors*, says it is working with cybersecurity experts, the UK **NCSC** and law enforcement to ensure the restart is carried out safely and securely.
- JLR thanked colleagues, retailers and suppliers for their patience, said foundational recovery work is underway, and promised further updates as progress continues.

items.title: SKF appoints Divya Purohit as India Head of LLS
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- SKF appointed *Divya Purohit* as India Head of *Lubrication Lifetime Solutions* (LLS), to lead innovation, lean manufacturing and customer value delivery.
- With 20+ years across South Asia, Europe and MEA, she will drive *local production*, digitalisation, AI and an expanded service network aligned with Make in India.
- SKF will prioritise *sustainability* and circularity, leveraging acquisitions (Lincoln, RecondOil, Alemite, Mityvac, JSG) and a *5+1R* reliability framework to reduce friction and downtime.

items.title: Iron ore dips on weak steel demand, China port stocks rise
items.summary:
- Iron ore futures slid — DCE January down *1.51%* to *784.5 yuan/ton* and SGX benchmark eased to *$105.25/ton* — pressured by sluggish *steel demand* and pre‑holiday restocking.  
- Chinese port inventories rose 0.29% w/w to about *132.5 million tons*, and brokers (Hexun, Everbright) warn continued arrivals and high molten‑iron output could push stocks higher.  
- Despite rising stocks, blast‑furnace utilisation climbed to *90.86%* while coking coal and coke fell (~4%), and Shanghai steel benchmarks also slipped, signaling mixed supply cues.

items.title: Critical minerals are stuck between demand hopes and oversupply reality: Russell
IRCLASS Systems and Solutions strengthens cybersecurity portfolio with 40% stake buy in eProtect 360 Solutions
Reliance Power to sell Indonesian coal units for $12M
items.summary:
- Reliance Power has agreed to sell 100% stakes in five Indonesian coal subsidiaries to *Biotruster (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.* for **$12 million**, with the deal signed Sep 29 and expected to close by Dec 30, 2025.
- The units generated *no income* last fiscal year and constituted only *0.53%* of Reliance Power’s consolidated net worth (₹16,909 lakh); the buyer is not a related party and it’s not a slump sale.
- The divestment is a minor overseas coal-holdings cleanup and is unlikely to materially affect Reliance Power’s financial position.

items.title: Accenture cuts 11,000 jobs amid AI restructuring
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- Accenture cut **11,000+** employees over three months, exiting roles where *reskilling* to AI skills was not considered viable.
- The AI-driven restructuring, continuing through Nov 2025, is projected to save over $1 billion and fund reinvestment and new hiring in AI capabilities.
- The firm has doubled AI/data specialists to 77,000, trained 550,000 on *generative AI*, and reported a 7% revenue rise, highlighting a broader industry shift.

items.title: Servotech to set up 3MW solar for Northern Central Rly
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Servotech won a *3MW* rooftop solar contract worth **₹13 crore** for Northern Central Railway’s *Agra Division*. 
- The company will handle design, manufacturing, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of solar panels across multiple Agra Division locations. 
- The initiative supports *Indian Railways*’ push for *renewable energy* to reduce dependence on conventional power.

items.title: UST and Kaynes Semicon to establish ₹3,330 crore semiconductor JV in Gujarat
GE Aerospace uses AI for engine design and maintenance at Bengaluru centre
Pune’s Cilicant story: From ‘Silica gel Wala’ to ₹200-cr pharma manufacturing force
Government mulls HAL restructuring for efficiency and faster deliveries
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Government* is exploring *restructuring* of *Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)* to boost efficiency and accelerate delivery of orders to the armed forces.
- An external consultancy is reviewing HAL as its *order book* tops ₹2.7 lakh crore, straining capacity and delaying programs like LCA and AMCA.
- Options include splitting HAL into specialized entities for fixed-wing, helicopters, and *MRO* to improve *delivery timelines*.

items.title: We are targeting ₹180 crore revenue for FY26: Venus Safety & Health MD
BL Agro, MoFPI to build ₹1,660cr hub in Bareilly
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- BL Agro signed an MoU with *MoFPI* to develop an export-oriented integrated *agro-processing hub* in *Bareilly*, committing **₹1,660 crore** over five years.
- Planned facilities include an automated *rice milling* unit for premium basmati, a 500 tonnes-per-day edible-oil extraction/refining plant (Bail Kolhu/Nourish), advanced packaging lines and **40,000 MT** grain storage, with Phase I due by 2027.
- The project targets stronger *food security* and *exports*, will create over **3,500 jobs**, adopt circular-economy practices, and receive MoFPI facilitation for clearances.

items.title: Telangana pushes to move from chip design to manufacturing
items.summary:
- Telangana is pushing to convert its strong *chip design* talent into local *chip manufacturing*, and is seeking central government support to host fabs.
- The state offers *incentives* and subsidies, with policy measures tailored by product and manufacturing type to attract semiconductor investment.
- Through the *T-CHIP* Summit and *TITA* initiatives like *Pitch2Press*, Telangana aims to build an ecosystem linking innovators, journalists, investors, and education to accelerate manufacturing.

items.title: Centre eyes umbrella law for nuclear energy; special tribunal for disputes
India poised to lead green hydrogen push
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- *India* is positioned to lead *green hydrogen* development thanks to a strong asset base and the National Green Hydrogen Mission (₹19,744 crore) targeting **5 Mt/yr by 2030** and 10% global trade.
- Government steps — hydrogen fuelling corridors, export-focused geography, and a ₹100 crore startup scheme — aim to build low-cost supply chains for exports to *EU, Japan,* and *South Korea*.
- S&P Global warns India must *sustain early momentum*, secure offtake agreements, and beat strong competitors to realize its export ambitions.

items.title: World’s largest 16,000 MW decentralised solar project likely to be ready by March 2026
Italy gets 10 bids for Ilva as major contenders withdraw
items.summary: - Italy received *10 bids* for the former Ilva plant, but only **Bedrock Industries** and a **Flacks Group–Steel Business Europe** consortium offered to buy all assets. - Major frontrunners **Baku Steel** (with Azerbaijan Investment Company) and *Jindal Steel* withdrew — Baku citing local opposition to a regasification vessel and Jindal shifting focus to *Thyssenkrupp*. - Acciaierie d'Italia will assess offers with emphasis on *employment*, *decarbonisation* and investment levels amid union calls for *nationalisation*.

items.title: Montra Electric targets ₹700 crore revenue this fiscal
India enters telecom-equipment manufacturers' club
items.summary:
- India became the fifth country to manufacture **telecom equipment** after *BSNL* launched an indigenous *4G stack*. 
- The government says the move shifts India from a services/consumer role to a hub for *production, innovation, entrepreneurship and exports*. 
- Officials expect improved connectivity in remote areas (border regions, islands, hills) and stronger strategic self-reliance in telecom supply chains.
